body_content.explanation: the process of making a man feel less male by taking away his power and confidence:
examples: Some male commentators on cable TV mocked her voice as shrill or joked about emasculation.
The programme portrays every cliché of working-class manhood and emasculation.

body_content.explanation: the act of castrating (= removing the male sexual parts of) a man or male animal, or removing the male parts of a plant:
examples: When it comes to neutering their male animals, squeamish men project their own fear of emasculation onto their animals.

body_content.explanation: the fact of making something less effective or reducing its power:
examples: He was committed to eliminating corruption and what he called the emasculation of civil institutions.
The emasculation of the police force has created a feeling of insecurity.
